Admiral Ilder Taramont was the commander of Nimpeths navy and the captain of the Wine & Song vessel in the late 14 century DR.
Ilder was one of three chancellors who advised Lord of Nimpeth â€“ Woren, despite having little skills to be an Admiral or even just a member of the navy. However, he was a quick-witted and subtle man.
Before Lord Woren became the leader of Nimpeth in the 14 century DR, Ilder Taramont made his name via deceit, trickery, and theft. When Woren rose to power, Ilder Taramont weaseled himself into the new Lords good graces and was assigned the position of Nimpeths Admiral. By the , Ilder learned the trade and commanded around twenty ships. His own ship was named Wine & Song from which the Admiral sent out navy patrols, ordered slave ships escorts, and managed safe sailing for the trade and transports ships that sailed to and from Nimpeth.
